Geographic origin: Cape Charles, Northampton County, Virginia, United States
Notes on original: Probably Magnolia (Brunswick). Fig plants in fruit seen at Cape Charles by [?]Ira J. Coudit in 10/1940 and known locally as Silver or Silver Leaf, were regarded by Coudit as being Magnolia, or more properly the true Brunswick of early horticultural literature. H.R. Fulton
Name: Ficus: Silver
